meanings.definition: A traditional Inuit parka made from caribou or seal skin.
meanings.sent1: She wore her warm atigi to stay cozy in the cold winter.
meanings.sent2: The atigi protected him from the harsh Arctic winds.
meanings.sent3: The atigi looked like a fluffy cloud wrapped around her.
meanings.sent4: His atigi was a shield against the freezing temperatures.
meanings.sent5: The atigi's intricate design showcased the craftsmanship of the Inuit people.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the Inuit people or their culture.
meanings.sent1: The atigi art displayed at the museum was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: She admired the atigi patterns woven into the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The atigi dance celebrated the rich heritage of the community.
meanings.sent4: His atigi songs echoed through the snowy landscape.
meanings.sent5: The atigi carvings told stories of generations past.

meanings.definition: To wear or put on an atigi.
meanings.sent1: She would atigi her parka before heading out into the blizzard.
meanings.sent2: He atigied the traditional garment with pride.
meanings.sent3: They decided to atigi their atigis for the special occasion.
meanings.sent4: Before the hunt, the hunters would atigi their protective gear.
meanings.sent5: In the Inuit culture, it is customary to atigi the atigi when going outside.
